snippet: Two exhibitions at the WheatonArts and Cultural Center commemorate the 50th anniversary of the era in which artists began to blow glass themselves instead of relying on factories.
abstract: Exhibitions Celebrating 50 Years: American Studio Glass and Pioneers of American Studio Glass: Edris Eckhardt, Maurice Heaton and Frances and Michael Higgins, both at WheatonArts and Cultural Center in Millville, commemorate the 50th anniversary of the era in which artists began to blow glass themselves instead of relying on factories (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: Two exhibitions at the WheatonArts and Cultural Center commemorate the 50th anniversary of the era in which artists began to blow glass themselves instead of relying on factories.

headline.seo: American Studio Glass Exhibitions at WheatonArts and Cultural Center
headline.main: The Evolution of a Movement, Preserved in Glass
headline.print_headline: The Evolution of a Movement, Preserved in Glass
